alert.note: Alert for Jasper; Mahaska; Palo Alto; Pocahontas; Story; Webster (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 06 at 2:49PM CST until January 07 at 9:00AM CST by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...Bitter Wind Chills Again Tonight Northeast Half... Bitter cold wind chills in the 20 to 30 below zero range will continue across portions of the north, northeast and east central areas through tonight. While the wind will be less by late evening, the actual temperature will drop into the 5 below to 20 below range with wind chill values once again the 20 to 30 below range across the advisory area. ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 AM CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected tonight. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. * WHERE...Parts of north central and central Iowa. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening through 9 AM CST Friday. * IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
